intro: Sarcostigma brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed sarcostigma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Sarcostigma brevipes is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
